item.description:
"A spellbinder you do not want to miss." - Peter Travers, Rolling Stone

"Using mostly amateur video shot by an aspiring rap artist and her husband in the lead-up to Hurricane Katrina and in the weeks after, this gripping, sometimes unstructured doc shows the devastation New Orleans residents suffered in the swirl of the storm." - Joe Neumaier, New York Daily News

"Filmmakers Tia Lessin and Carl Deal have fashioned a deeply moving story of resilience and redemption." - Joanne Kaufman, Wall Street Journal

"Brilliant melding of first-person footage, heart, and directors Tia Lessin and Carl Deal's documentary expertise." - John Anderson, Newsday

"This incredible documentary displays the tragedy and mismanagement of Katrina along with the heroism of strangers and survivors." - Critical Consensus about Trouble the Water, per Rotten Tomatoes

Trouble the Water is a 2008 Sundance Grand Jury Prize winning documentary directed by Tia Lessin and Carl Deal. Although you may not recognize Lessin and Deal by name, you are probably familiar with their work since they both produced Michael Moore's documentaries Bowling for Columbine and Fahrenheit 911.

Trouble the Water, however, is not a Michael Moore documentary but of home footage from filmmaker and musician Kimberly Rivers Roberts and her husband Scott juxtaposed with broadcast news coverage of Hurricane Katrina.

This documentary looks very promising as it has gotten very good reviews thus far (represented by a 96% Tomatometer rating on Rotten Tomatoes). Hopefully, this film will provide for some thoughtful dinner discussion afterward, as we recall Hurricane Katrina 3 years later in the wake of Hurricane Gustav.

Note: The Kendall website says that the film will be playing at 4 pm on 9/13. I will check this a week from now (on 9/10) to confirm that the Kendall hasn't gone and changed this. If the time does change, I'll send an email to all the yeses and maybes.
